reviewText: The Only thing I would have loved more is if they had more seasons .  I waited too long to get this and am so thrilled to finally have all the series on dvd . i want to watch them all the time but life has its demands hehe so I must go and live life too .. but thank you again for making these available I am thrilled ...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Tia Carrere is just outstanding, street smart, intelligent, and very attractive. Tia has it all. The episodes are action-packed and very well written. The scripts are far more realistic than anything Hollywood can come up with and are head and shoulders above many of the movies we are seeing today. There is so much action and suspense in each episode that catches the viewers attention that the episodes are almost over as soon as they begin. The time just flies by so quickly. Wake up Hollywood and just try to make an action-packed series like relic hunter. Now a days Hollywood just can't do it, won't do it, or just don't know how. Indiana Jones step aside, there's a new relic hunter in town and ready to kick butt. Great series, don't miss it, its ACTION in capital letters. Thanks.
summary: Relic Hunter:A Treasure that you don't  want to miss.

reviewText: There were several problems with these DVDs skipping through the episodes and not being able to see the end of the episode. I am disappointed because it happened at crucial moments of the episode. Nice to see a 'female' lead in an action adventure series. I think it gives young women a role model. I would compare these to the Indiana Jones movies.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Relic Hunter's third season is very much like its first two, only more so--intriguing historical relics(most of them fictional), bad guys, and faux archaeology; a shameless ripoff of Indiana Jones, but still fun. Tia Carerre is actually fairly convincing, even if her Sydney Fox is a terrible teacher--she's never in the classroom! This is fairly well done, budget Indiana Jones--only prettier.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The third and final season of 'RELIC HUNTER' starts off with a major change, the character of Claudia played by Lindy Booth has been replaced with blonde eye candy Karen Petrusky played by Tanya Reichert who begins the series as a romantic possibility for Nigel but then gets placed in the background just to make faxes, phone calls and be a foil while Syd and Nigel are out hunting. There are also changes on the production end: actor Simon MaCorkingdale appears as executive Producer and also plays villain DaViega who is responsible for murdering Sydney's mentor which spring boarded her to become a relic hunter and who appears in a multiple episode story arc throughout the season; Frank Cardea and George Schenck as executive consultants; new director of photography Alwyn Kumst and Production Designer Jacques Bradette with new locations in China, Ireland, and Egypt.  The feel of the show is different, some episodes show Sydney's romantic side as each segment includes a rival or ex-lover relic hunter who aid or hinder her searches and the comic book feel of past seasons has been replaced with a feeling of espionage thrillers which may have put off some viewers but gives the series a good shot of adrenalin.  Some unique guest stars appear: Claudia Christian who appeared as Commander Ivanova in the classic 'BABYLON 5' series; Ralf Moeller who played Conan the Barbarian in the one season series 'CONAN THE ADVENTURER' and played various musclemen/viking roles; Adrian Paul who was Duncan Macleod on the series 'HIGHLANDER' and Joanie Launer aka China, the WWF champion whose fight between her and Tia Carrere is worth the price of the box set.  Sydney relinquishes her gadgets and relies more on her wits and martial arts and Nigel is less bumbling even getting in on the fisticuffs as the relics become more of a fusion for the storylines and characters. The series could have gone on for at least another season for the final episode ends in a cliff hanger involving DaViega but it was not to be.  In retrospect, the series has evolved into one of the best and most underrated in genre television and Ms. Carrere should be comfortable in knowing that she will be forever immortalized as Sydney Fox. She recently appeared as a police inspector on the hit SyFy series 'WAREHOUSE 13' and still had that Sydney smirk and attitude.  Alliance releases it the same as the other two seasons, no extras and poor packaging but who can quibble when you're getting the complete saga.  For all lovers of action and antiquities, it is inconceivable not to have this series as part of your viewing experience and for Tia Carrere as in that great line from one of the James Bond theme songs 'BABY, YOU'RE THE BEST'.
Title: N/A
